column1: '''Syx Mynet''' is a translation into [[Old English]] by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] of the [[Wikipedia:Nursery rhyme
column2: nursery rhyme]] "I Love Sixpence". The translation was done by Tolkien ca. [[1924]]. It was published in ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]'' in [[1936]].<ref name=Leeds>{{webcite
column5: articlename=Archive File: Syx Mynet and Lá Húru

column1: The poem was rendered in pen and ink, together with Tolkien's poem [[Lá Húru]], on one leaf. The manuscript is kept in the Tolkien-Gordon Collection at the Library of the [[University of Leeds]].<ref name=Leeds/>
